description: Assesses structured persuasive essay with evidence

levels.4: Clear, specific thesis that takes a definite position
levels.2: Thesis is vague or doesn't clearly state a position

feedback_stems.strength: Your thesis was clear and specific:
feedback_stems.growth: Strengthen your thesis by making your position more specific and debatable

levels.4: Strong evidence (facts, examples, anecdotes) that clearly supports each point
levels.2: Some evidence but weak or not clearly connected to claims
levels.1: Little to no evidence; just opinions

feedback_stems.growth: Add specific facts, examples, or stories to back up your points

levels.4: Clear introduction, body paragraphs with topic sentences, and conclusion
levels.3: Essay has clear structure with some organization
levels.2: Some attempt at structure but paragraphs unclear

feedback_stems.strength: Your essay was well-organized with clear paragraphs
feedback_stems.growth: Start each body paragraph with a topic sentence that states your point

levels.4: Addresses counterargument thoughtfully and refutes it
levels.2: Briefly mentions opposition but doesn't engage

feedback_stems.strength: You addressed the other side when you said
feedback_stems.growth: Consider what someone who disagrees would say, then explain why they're wrong

levels.4: Conclusion reinforces thesis and calls reader to action or thought
levels.2: Conclusion is weak or just repeats introduction

feedback_stems.strength: Your conclusion was strong because it
feedback_stems.growth: End by telling readers what to do or think about your argument
